plugins.name: Better Duplicate
plugins.description:
Duplicate selected frames to the right or downwards. Frames would be automatically arranged in a row or column based on their positions.


While iterating on a new design I felt a lot of friction from the native frame duplication process: it's hard to quickly duplicate frames and make sure they end up exactly where I want. Additionally, they can only be duplicated horizontally on canvas while I frequently add vertical iterations as well. Native duplication also doesn't work with multiple frames. To avoid needing to manually arrange frames while iterating quickly I created this plugin.
plugins.tagline: Duplicate frames right or down using smart algorithms for their placement

plugins.name: Lingoport Localyzer
plugins.description:
Fast-track your FIGMA design work for translation via Lingoport‚Äôs FIGMA connector to Localyzer. Lingoport provides a full range of continuous localization solutions. Translate now with an automated process, whether with humans or machines, so that localization moves at the speed of development. Use machine translation or pseudo-localize so you can immediately see how your U/I will look in target languages. For more information, visit https://lingoport.com.



Getting Started

To get started, you will need a Lingoport Command Center API user account and at least one project set up with Localyzer. To set up an account, please contact us.


Launch The Plugin

1. Open your Figma design file.

2. Go to Plugins and select Lingoport Localyzer.

3. Log in with your Command Center username, generated API token, and URL to the server you are connecting to.

4. Select one of your existing Command Center projects to connect to the Figma file.

6. Select "Finish Setup" to save the selected project.


Using The Plugin

When setup is complete, you can start using the plugin by exporting selected strings to your saved Command Center project. Once translations are complete on Command Center, you can translate your Figma designs into your target languages.



Need Help?

Please contact us at figma@lingoport.com for any questions or assistance.

accepted.description: Since 2001, Lingoport has been helping companies internationalize and localize their software using our suite of products and expert i18n services.

plugins.tagline: Easily translate Figma designs (strings) into different languages.

Are you tired of manually updating variables one by one across your Figma files? This plugin is the powerful solution you've been waiting for, saving design teams hundreds of hours of tedious work.

  1. One-Click Variable Replacement ‚Äî Replace any variable throughout your entire page instantly
  2. Comprehensive Variable Support ‚Äî Works with dimensions, strokes, fills, shadows, fonts, and more
  3. Style Integration ‚Äî Even replace the variable in styles that use your target variables, ensuring complete system consistency
  4. Multiple Library Sources ‚Äî Select variables from both local and team shared libraries
  5. Lightning-Fast Performance ‚Äî Process thousands of elements in seconds
  6. Design System Friendly ‚Äî Perfect for design system refactoring and maintenance

  1. Select the variable you want to replace

  5. That's it! All instances are updated instantly

plugins.name: Contrast checker
plugins.description:
Contrast Checker is a Figma plugin designed to help designers ensure their designs are accessible by automatically analyzing text and background color contrast within selected frames. The plugin checks for compliance with accessibility standards, highlights potential issues, and provides detailed reports, enabling you to create inclusive and user-friendly designs effortlessly.



What the Plugin Does


‚Ä¢Automatic Contrast Analysis: The plugin scans selected frames to identify text elements and their background colors, calculating the contrast ratio between them.

‚Ä¢Accessibility Compliance: It checks whether the contrast ratios meet the WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) standards, specifically for normal and large text.

‚Ä¢Detailed Reports: After analysis, the plugin generates a comprehensive report that highlights any text elements that do not meet the required contrast ratios, providing actionable feedback.

‚Ä¢Issue Highlighting: Users can locate specific elements with contrast issues directly within their design by using the ‚ÄúLocate‚Äù feature.

‚Ä¢Ignore Option: If certain elements are intentionally designed with lower contrast, users can choose to ignore those specific issues.



How to Use the Plugin


1.Select a Frame: Start by selecting the frame or frames within your Figma document that you want to analyze.

2.Run the Plugin: Launch the Contrast Checker plugin. It will automatically start analyzing the selected frame(s).

3.View the Report: Once the analysis is complete, view the detailed report generated by the plugin. This report will list all the text elements within the frame(s) and indicate whether they meet the required contrast ratio.

4.Address Issues: Use the ‚ÄúLocate‚Äù button to find and fix elements with contrast issues in your design.

5.Manage Issues: Optionally, ignore any issues that you don‚Äôt need to fix by using the ‚ÄúIgnore‚Äù feature.



Limitations


‚Ä¢Text Detection: The plugin only analyzes visible text elements and solid background colors. It may not correctly analyze text with gradient backgrounds, images, or complex overlays.

‚Ä¢Performance: The plugin performs best on smaller frames or a limited number of selected frames at once. Analyzing very large frames with numerous text elements may take longer.

‚Ä¢Customization: Currently, the plugin does not support custom contrast thresholds beyond the WCAG standards, and it does not provide options for customizing the analysis parameters.


By using the Contrast Checker, designers can ensure their work is accessible, improving the overall inclusivity of their designs.
plugins.tagline: boost accessibility w/ seamless contrast checks ‚Äî ensure every design is inclusive & user-friendly!

100458.name: Contrast checker
100458.description:
Contrast Checker is a Figma plugin designed to help designers ensure their designs are accessible by automatically analyzing text and background color contrast within selected frames. The plugin checks for compliance with accessibility standards, highlights potential issues, and provides detailed reports, enabling you to create inclusive and user-friendly designs effortlessly.



What the Plugin Does


‚Ä¢Automatic Contrast Analysis: The plugin scans selected frames to identify text elements and their background colors, calculating the contrast ratio between them.

‚Ä¢Accessibility Compliance: It checks whether the contrast ratios meet the WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) standards, specifically for normal and large text.

‚Ä¢Detailed Reports: After analysis, the plugin generates a comprehensive report that highlights any text elements that do not meet the required contrast ratios, providing actionable feedback.

‚Ä¢Issue Highlighting: Users can locate specific elements with contrast issues directly within their design by using the ‚ÄúLocate‚Äù feature.

‚Ä¢Ignore Option: If certain elements are intentionally designed with lower contrast, users can choose to ignore those specific issues.



How to Use the Plugin


1.Select a Frame: Start by selecting the frame or frames within your Figma document that you want to analyze.

2.Run the Plugin: Launch the Contrast Checker plugin. It will automatically start analyzing the selected frame(s).

3.View the Report: Once the analysis is complete, view the detailed report generated by the plugin. This report will list all the text elements within the frame(s) and indicate whether they meet the required contrast ratio.

4.Address Issues: Use the ‚ÄúLocate‚Äù button to find and fix elements with contrast issues in your design.

5.Manage Issues: Optionally, ignore any issues that you don‚Äôt need to fix by using the ‚ÄúIgnore‚Äù feature.



Limitations


‚Ä¢Text Detection: The plugin only analyzes visible text elements and solid background colors. It may not correctly analyze text with gradient backgrounds, images, or complex overlays.

‚Ä¢Performance: The plugin performs best on smaller frames or a limited number of selected frames at once. Analyzing very large frames with numerous text elements may take longer.

‚Ä¢Customization: Currently, the plugin does not support custom contrast thresholds beyond the WCAG standards, and it does not provide options for customizing the analysis parameters.


By using the Contrast Checker, designers can ensure their work is accessible, improving the overall inclusivity of their designs.
100458.tagline: boost accessibility w/ seamless contrast checks ‚Äî ensure every design is inclusive & user-friendly!

Ever dreamed of turning your Figma designs into glorious, ultra-responsive code with just a couple of clicks? Well, dream no more, friend‚Äîthis plugin is your magic wand!

  1. Select your Figma layer: Want the entire page? Click it. Only need a nifty component? Select it.

  3. Download your freshly minted code: HTML, CSS, Angular, and more! Plus, assets are included.
  4. Name your components: Enter your preferred component names, and we‚Äôll use them to create files tailored to your needs.
  5. Success! You just dodged hours of hand-coding. Cue confetti!


New Features You‚Äôll Love:


Angular Tech Stack: Now supporting Angular with advanced settings to fit your specific needs.


Tailwind & Bootstrap Support: For HTML/CSS conversion, you can now choose between Tailwind and Bootstrap frameworks.


Custom Component Naming: Add a personal touch to your files by naming components as per your preference.


Oh, and don‚Äôt forget:


  1. Every day, you‚Äôll get 5 free Zapcoins for your code generation adventures. Need more? You can now buy Zapcoins directly within the plugin via Buy Me a Coffee.

  3. First, click the ‚ÄúAPI Key‚Äù button to feed our AI (we use Anthropic‚Äôs API)‚Äîyour key is stored securely in Figma's storage. Converted files are also saved there for safekeeping. No shady external servers, promise!
  4. No need to enter API key while using free Zapcoins, Gemini will be used to convert your designs.


Now go forth, fearless designer, and code all the things‚Ä¶without actually writing code. Because that‚Äôs how we roll! üöÄ

plugins.name: Moospire
plugins.description:
Description for Moospire Figma Plugin;

Moospire‚Äôs Figma plugin is designed to revolutionize how you create and curate moodboards. Whether you're sourcing inspiration from the web or harnessing the power of AI to bring your unique visions to life, this plugin is ideal for designers seeking an efficient way to visualize and consolidate design concepts directly within your Figma projects.


What to Expect from the Moospire Figma Plugin

1. Seamless Web Curation:

This feature allows you to explore and curate moodboards by compiling the most inspiring and relevant content found across the web. Whether you're looking for design trends, color schemes, or visual ideas, Moospire makes it easy to gather these elements directly into your Figma workspace.


2. AI-Powered Creation:

Transform your thoughts into beautifully cohesive moodboards with just a few clicks. Submit your concepts via text, images, sketches, or even voice notes, and watch as Moospire‚Äôs AI effortlessly crafts these inputs into structured moodboards. This feature is particularly beneficial for capturing the essence of spontaneous ideas and turning them into actionable designs.


How to Use the Moospire Figma Plugin

Installation: Begin by installing the Moospire plugin from the Figma plugin store.

Launching Moospire: Access Moospire directly within your Figma project by navigating to the plugin section and selecting Moospire.

Searching and Curating: Use the search feature to find web content or let Moospire suggest materials based on search & past preferences.

Creating with AI: Upload your creative inputs through the plugin‚Äôs interface, and specify the type of moodboard content you need. The AI will process your inputs and generate a moodboard ideas right within your Figma canvas.
plugins.tagline: The Spark you need to create

plugins.name: Timesaver: Conditionally Select, Rename, Export, Delete, Duplicate
plugins.description:
The plugin code is open-sourced on Github https://github.com/fireinureeyes/figma-timesaver-plugin


Stop doing things one by one and save time instead

Define your custom conditions and quickly filter out any subset of elements across your file.

Then choose one of the actions to bulk process them.


Example use cases

SELECT all groups not using auto layout,

RENAME all frames on the bottom half of the screen (regex allowed),

EXPORT all icons of a specific layer name format,

DELETE all masks or locked elements,

DUPLICATE and collect all components on one page,

or EXPORT A LIST of elements as a CSV file for documentation purposes.

The possibilities are endless...


Freely combine more than 80 properties to get what you need

Use logical AND and OR to build up complex conditions from:

Scope:

  1. Current page
  2. Whole document
  3. Existing selection


Object type:

  1. Components
  2. Instances
  3. Texts
  4. Shapes (rectangles, stars, lines, polygons...)
  5. Sections
  6. Vectors
  7. Groups
  8. Frames
  9. Boolean operations (unions, substracts, intersects, excludes)


General object properties:

  1. Layer name
  2. Page name
  3. Width
  4. Height
  5. X-Coordinate
  6. Y-Coordinate
  7. Visibility
  8. Rotation
  9. Number of children
  10. Nested level
  11. Number of points (paths)
  12. Locked state
  13. Mask state
  14. Export setting
  15. Overridden properties


Appearance:

  1. Rounding
  2. Fill
  3. Stroke
  4. Stroke color
  5. Opacity
  6. Blendmode
  7. Fill blendmode
  8. Fill opacity
  9. Fill visibility
  10. Stroke opacity
  11. Stroke blendmode
  12. Stroke visiblity
  13. Stroke type
  14. Stroke alignment


Effects:

  1. Drop shadow active
  2. Drop shadow x-offset
  3. Drop shadow y-offset
  4. Drop shadow blur
  5. Drop shadow spread
  6. Drop shadow color
  7. Drop shadow blendmode
  8. Inner shadow active
  9. Inner shadow x-offset
  10. Inner shadow y-offset
  11. Inner shadow blur
  12. Inner shadow spread
  13. Inner shadow color
  14. Inner shadow blendmode
  15. Layer blur active
  16. Background blur active


Text:

  1. Font name
  2. Font size
  3. Line height
  4. Letter spacing
  5. Font weight
  6. Horizontal alignment type
  7. Vertical alignment type
  8. Text decoration underline
  9. Text decoration strikethrough
  10. Paragraph indentation
  11. Paragraph spacing


Auto layout:

  1. Auto layout active
  2. Position
  3. Direction
  4. Item spacing
  5. Padding top
  6. Padding bottom
  7. Padding left
  8. Padding Right


Interaction:

  1. Interaction active
  2. Interaction trigger
  3. Interaction action
  4. Flow starting point


Or narrow down your selection manually from the results list. Clicking on the results will locate the elements on the canvas, so you can easily see what is being adjusted before executing the action.


Renaming supports the following variables:

  1. {id} - unique number
  2. {name} - original layer name
  3. {page} - name of the page where the layer is located
  4. {date} - current date in a YYYY-MM-DD format
  5. {alphabet} - letter sequence a-z
plugins.tagline: Define your custom conditions and quickly filter out any subset of elements across your file.

plugins.name: Reablocks Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
Reablocks Figma Plugin

Plugin utilities to supercharge your dev work for reablocks (an open-source repo containing a set of enterprise UI components for React).


Features

CSS Token Generator: Generate Reablock-compatible JSON from Figma Style variables


CSS Token Generator Usage


Pre-requisite

You should have style created for all colors that you want to use in the project

You should use the following naming convention to assign style property to your colors

E.g.: 'Primary', 'Brand', 'Primary/100', 'Brand/title black 100'``


# Running Plugin

- Go to the Figma design file where you want to use the plugin

- Use `CMD + p` to open quick menu

- Search for new plugins using "Find More plugins option" and search for "Reablocks Figma Plugin"

- Once found, click on run plugin, it will open a popup

- Click on "Generate CSS"

- Click on "Copy CSS"

- Use the copied CSS tokens to your project


Development guide

Check the readme file @ https://github.com/reaviz/reablocks-figma-plugin/blob/main/README.md for dev contribution guidelines
plugins.tagline: Your Figma companion for Reablock

plugins.name: Paper (Beta)
plugins.description:
The Paper plugin is a simple plugin designed to help users efficiently take and organize notes directly within their Figma files. Whether you're collaborating on a design project, documenting ideas, or adding context to your work, this plugin provides a seamless way to capture and manage your thoughts without leaving the Figma environment.


Key Features:


Heading Styles: Easily structure your notes with customizable heading styles, making it easy to organize your content.

Text Formatting: Use bold, italics, and other text formatting options to emphasize important information.

To-Do Lists: Stay on top of tasks with built-in to-do list functionality, helping you track progress and prioritize work.

Bulleted and Numbered Lists: Organize your notes with clean, easy-to-read lists for quick reference.

Privacy-Focused: All data remains within the plugin, ensuring that no information is sent outside your Figma file. Your notes are securely stored and only accessible to you and your collaborators.


Future updates will continue to expand on these features, offering even more tools to enhance your note-taking experience within Figma.


Perfect for designers, developers, and teams who need a flexible and private note-taking solution integrated directly into their design workflow!
